ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the most significant U.S. court cases of the twentieth century and their key implications. The course highlighted the major flaws of the American judicial system and how it has evolved in the past century.
I learned about many of the important trials of the 20th century, important legal concepts, and how to write concisely.

I LOVED this course!!!!!! I could not speak of it more highly. I learned about several trials in a dynamic and interesting manner, and I, along with all of the other students, engaged with the professor and the material in every single class.
About trial conduct
Incredible seminar. One of the best at Yale.
Great overview of American trials

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This was an incredible course. It was interesting, engaging, and had a reasonable amount of work. I don't think it could be improved.

Strengths: incredible syllabus, warm classroom environment, engaging professor

Weaknesses: truly, none

The greatest strength of this course is Professor Ford, who is truly wonderful. Not only is he a master of the material, but he also cares deeply about all of his students, learning all of our names even prior to the first day of class. He also assigns great readings and videos to make each trial more dynamic. I would not change a thing!
The best professor ever!!

Strengths- the readings and professor
Weaknesses- only getting to meet once a week!
The cases are incredibly powerful and everyone should know them.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! This was probably my favorite course I have taken at Yale. Professor Ford is a very engaging teacher and the material itself was very interesting and unlike any other course I have taken. If you can get into this class you must take it.
YES! Every senior should try to take this course if possible. It is a must-take seminar.
Absolutely! Professor Ford is great, the material is great, and the workload is in no way burdensome. If you can get in, take it!

ABSOLUTELY!!! Ford cares so much about his students and really takes the time to get to know you. The material is also incredibly interesting and he chooses such awesome people to take the class with.
This is the best course I have taken at Yale. Prof Ford is unmatched!
Yes, fantastic class
Yes, one of the best courses Ive taken in my four years.
Yes
